functional.notes: Docs templates exist for navigation and runbooks; generation produces consistent generated markdown surfaces.
findings: Runbooks clearly document create/audit/close flows and reference the canonical prompt templates for repeatability.
Generated markdown is protected from hand-edits by guardrails frontmatter checks.

correctness_safety.notes: Docs are template-driven (single-source-of-truth) and reinforce governance invariants.
findings: Navigation doc explicitly distinguishes sources vs generated outputs.

performance.notes: Docs generation cost scales with template count and is deterministic.
findings: No runtime/perf concerns beyond generation-time IO.

security.notes: Docs templates are static; no security-sensitive logic.

maintainability.notes: Templates are scoped and link to prompt templates; makes future workflow changes discoverable.
findings: Runbooks stay aligned by centralizing workflow entry points.

summary.notes: Templates are clear and actionable; strongest benefit is onboarding and governance consistency.
